title: Affair FOUR All: The Results
body_text:
Standin' in line to the see the show tonight ...
Jacobs, Vetrano Highlight
FA IV
A magical journey to superstardom. A multiple-year odyssey to culimination.
And the intersection at which they collide - it's
Family Affair IV
!
Rookie sensation Jacobs was awarded first pick by winning the pre-match coin flip and carefully chose the dangerous, deadly force Kevin Fitzpatrick. In an effort to mirror such a solid selection, veteran Vetrano drafted Fitz's longstanding nemesis, Chris Adams. After Justin "Punter" Wolf, "King" John Tronolone, and the rest of the megastars were equally divided, the titanic-sized war of wars commenced without a hitch.
MATCH SUMMARY
Right from the get-go, prepped 'ballers knew this was gauranteed to be one hotly-contested confrontation. But few could accurately predict the outcome of each individual battle, even when three, or two combatants remained for either team. All it took was a strategic grab or, if available, a rim-smackin' team regeneration to turn the tide.
Proof of the encounter's tightness came in the first four games, split between the army generals. Vetrano's pivotal round 5 triumph finally generated enough momentum to capture the multi-point edge in the following bouts and secure the monumental victory.
Bobby Vetrano
defeated
Kenny Jacobs
, 5 to 3, and the 4th annual
Family Affair
.
MATCH ANALYSIS
Defensive plays may have greatly affected the outcome of the physically-taxing, four-hour showdown. Vetrano-chosen allies like Zach "The Big Kat" Katz, "The Axe" Adams, and "The Creation" Tronolone were key, each with a collection of wisely-timed catches. Sneaky trickshots perpetrated by Travis "Maniac" Mills, Devin Rich's fierce overhand throw, and the clutch performances by Lauren Stopa were extremely crucial.
The Jacobs-lead charge, while unable to attain the "W", was an adequate piece of machinery. The uncanny power behind Fitzpatrick, Wolf, and Pierce, the resilient right-handed throws from southpaw Kevin Megill, and the overall athletic efforts performed by Kelly Oberto inflicted plenty of damage upon their adversaries.
INJURY REPORT
Other than sore muscles, minor scrapes, and a few bruises, zero serious injuries came out of
Family Affair IV
.
FAMILY & FRIENDS
Without the support of those cherished loves ones, it just wouldn't be, well, a "Family Affair"! The cast of characters cheering in the stands was plentiful:
→ Gaile Adams and Aunt Cicely proudly represented brothers Chris and Steve Adams
→ Anthony Casbarro, afro and all, rooted for good buddy and headliner, Kenny Jacobs
→ Darrell Tronolone, "Grandma" Nancy Tronolone, Anthony and Darlene Pontecorvo, and beloved family friend Georgi Gilmartin clapped and applauded John Tronolone
→ Chelsie Winston, Alysha Kelly, and
ECDElitist
Lauren Winston made surprise visits
2010 was a tremendous calendar for
East Coast Dodgeball
, the eminent
ECDElite
Hall of Fame surely a reason why. Last year, 11 of the most physically dominating, creatively instrumental, socially influential, and longtime contributing individuals were deservingly inducted. So it was only fitting to continue the tradition and further the legacy at the 4th annual
Family Affair
. Meet the class of 2011:
LAUREN STOPA
♦
Player Profile
: Born June 15, 1986; Debut November 5, 2005 at DODGEBALL XTWO; 88 events participated; Right-handed
♦
Career Highlights
: 1x season finale headliner; 1x anniversary event headliner; 1x mid-season main eventer; 1x
Rimshot Contest
champion
♦
Awards & Accolades
: 2010 "Appreciation"; 2007 "Player of the Year" finalist
♦
Major Contributions
: innovator of special birthday celebrations in 2007; participated in
CREAMation 5
; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts; purchased many dodgeballs
JOHN TRONOLONE
♦
Player Profile
: Born September 27, 1984; Debut September 3, 2005 at DODGEBALL DAY 1; 180 events participated; Right-handed
♦
Career Highlights
: 4x season finale headliner; 1x anniversary event headliner; 1x mid-season main eventer; 6x
Battle Royal
champion
[first-ever, most all-time]
; 1x
Rimshot Contest
champion
♦
Awards & Accolades
: 2010 "Perfect Attendance"; 2008 "Captain of the Year" finalist; 2007 "Concept of the Year"
(
CREAMation Rules
)
; 2006 "High Jump"
♦
Major Contributions
: innovator of
PickYourPoison
,
CREAMation Rules
,
White Flag
, and
EnduraDodgeball
matches; innovator of
Rimshot Contest
,
Hit The Human Contest
, and
Championship Chase
secondary attractions; innovator of
Dodgeball Draft
and
Secret Selection
; co-innovator of
Wall vs. All
(with R. Letsche)
; participated in
CREAMations 1, 6, 9
; created various promotional posters; put together several musical soundtracks; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts; purchased many dodgeballs
East Coast Dodgeball
could not be more appreciative of the endless effort put forth by these legends. Their remarkable committment has undoubtedly provided a plethora of unforgettable moments for the entire
ECD
community.
The exclusive induction ceremony can be viewed below as filmed by newcomer Rob Knott and hosted by fellow
Elitist
Christopher Adams.
Attendance
: 24, comprised of 16 men and 8 women. This was the largest turnout in the past four months.
New Dodgeballers
: 3 - Grace Buckley, Devin Rich, Rob Knott.
Game Rules
: Classic two-team.
Featured Match
: Bobby Vetrano defeated Kenny Jacobs, 5 - 3. Eight games is the highest total number for any
Family Affair
event.
Game-By-Game Results
: Vetrano 1, 3, 5-7; Jacobs 2, 4, 8
Captains Records
: Vetrano 1-2-1; Jacobs 0-1-0
→ Vetrano won his very first singles match, having previously been vanquished by Rob Pellecchia and Ryan Letsche in the spring of 2008. This was his second time in a season finale-type outing, having competed as one of six captains at DODGEBALL 150 in the summer of 2008.
→ Jacobs became the astounding 80th recorded captain in
ECD
history. He joins Jason Teitelbaum and Jon Yochum as the only players whose debut match was at a
Family Affair
extravaganza.
Entrance Anthems
: In an
ECD
first, entrance themes were used for each of the leading captains. Jacobs selected "Not Afraid" by Eminem while Vetrano went with Metallica's "For Whom The Bell Tolls".
ECDElite Inductees
: Congratulations to Lauren Stopa and John Tronolone who became the 12th and 13th inductees into the prestigious Hall of Fame. The union of
ECDElitist
who preceded them are Kevin Megill, Justin Pierce, Valerie Winston, Ryan Letsche, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Chris Adams, Lauren Winston, Michael Edwards, Kevin Adams, Diana DiBuccio, and Michael "Sputz" Krott.
Raffle Winner
: Congratulations to Justin Wolf who walked away with $10 worth of scratch-offs and a $10 Wawa gift card. Special thanks to both Katie Grand and Rob Knott who purchased the prize.
Musical Playlist
: John Tronolone and Kevin Fitzpatrick
Theme Song
: Red Hot Chili Peppers "By The Way"
________________________________________
__________________________
The History of
Family Affair
Family Affair I
| May 31, 2008
NOTES: Chronologically known as DODGEBALL CXL (140), the inaugural event produced an amazing 39 competitors and over 20 close friends and relatives watching from the sidelines.
MAIN EVENT: Justin Wolf fought Juan Londono to a 2-2 tie. The infamous Wolf-Londono rivalry was jumpstarted at
FA I
- the first of three barbaric contest between them that year.
Family Affair II
| May 23, 2009
NOTES: Officially hyped as
Family Reunion
, it is the sole event within the
Tronolone Era
where no numerical statistics other than the match result were recorded.
MAIN EVENT: Jason Teitelbaum defeated Jon Yochum, 4 - 1. To date, this is the only time either Teitelbaum or Yochum have been leading general.
Family Affair III
| July 24, 2010
NOTES: This monumental event ushered in the rebirth of
East Coast Dodgeball
on a monthly basis.
MAIN EVENT: Sascha Basista defeated Joey Smalls, 4 - 2. This was the deciding bout in their best of three series.
body_html:
Standin' in line to the see the show tonight ...

Jacobs, Vetrano Highlight FA IV
A magical journey to superstardom. A multiple-year odyssey to culimination.
And the intersection at which they collide - it's Family Affair IV!

Rookie sensation Jacobs was awarded first pick by winning the pre-match coin flip and carefully chose the dangerous, deadly force Kevin Fitzpatrick. In an effort to mirror such a solid selection, veteran Vetrano drafted Fitz's longstanding nemesis, Chris Adams. After Justin "Punter" Wolf, "King" John Tronolone, and the rest of the megastars were equally divided, the titanic-sized war of wars commenced without a hitch.

MATCH SUMMARY
Right from the get-go, prepped 'ballers knew this was gauranteed to be one hotly-contested confrontation. But few could accurately predict the outcome of each individual battle, even when three, or two combatants remained for either team. All it took was a strategic grab or, if available, a rim-smackin' team regeneration to turn the tide.

Proof of the encounter's tightness came in the first four games, split between the army generals. Vetrano's pivotal round 5 triumph finally generated enough momentum to capture the multi-point edge in the following bouts and secure the monumental victory.

Bobby Vetrano defeated Kenny Jacobs, 5 to 3, and the 4th annual Family Affair.

MATCH ANALYSIS
Defensive plays may have greatly affected the outcome of the physically-taxing, four-hour showdown. Vetrano-chosen allies like Zach "The Big Kat" Katz, "The Axe" Adams, and "The Creation" Tronolone were key, each with a collection of wisely-timed catches. Sneaky trickshots perpetrated by Travis "Maniac" Mills, Devin Rich's fierce overhand throw, and the clutch performances by Lauren Stopa were extremely crucial.

The Jacobs-lead charge, while unable to attain the "W", was an adequate piece of machinery. The uncanny power behind Fitzpatrick, Wolf, and Pierce, the resilient right-handed throws from southpaw Kevin Megill, and the overall athletic efforts performed by Kelly Oberto inflicted plenty of damage upon their adversaries.

INJURY REPORT
Other than sore muscles, minor scrapes, and a few bruises, zero serious injuries came out of Family Affair IV.

FAMILY & FRIENDS
Without the support of those cherished loves ones, it just wouldn't be, well, a "Family Affair"! The cast of characters cheering in the stands was plentiful:
→ Gaile Adams and Aunt Cicely proudly represented brothers Chris and Steve Adams
→ Anthony Casbarro, afro and all, rooted for good buddy and headliner, Kenny Jacobs
→ Darrell Tronolone, "Grandma" Nancy Tronolone, Anthony and Darlene Pontecorvo, and beloved family friend Georgi Gilmartin clapped and applauded John Tronolone
→ Chelsie Winston, Alysha Kelly, and ECDElitist Lauren Winston made surprise visits


2010 was a tremendous calendar for East Coast Dodgeball, the eminent ECDElite Hall of Fame surely a reason why. Last year, 11 of the most physically dominating, creatively instrumental, socially influential, and longtime contributing individuals were deservingly inducted. So it was only fitting to continue the tradition and further the legacy at the 4th annual Family Affair. Meet the class of 2011:

LAUREN STOPA
♦ Player Profile: Born June 15, 1986; Debut November 5, 2005 at DODGEBALL XTWO; 88 events participated; Right-handed
♦ Career Highlights: 1x season finale headliner; 1x anniversary event headliner; 1x mid-season main eventer; 1x Rimshot Contest champion
♦ Awards & Accolades: 2010 "Appreciation"; 2007 "Player of the Year" finalist
♦ Major Contributions: innovator of special birthday celebrations in 2007; participated in CREAMation 5; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts; purchased many dodgeballs

JOHN TRONOLONE
♦ Player Profile: Born September 27, 1984; Debut September 3, 2005 at DODGEBALL DAY 1; 180 events participated; Right-handed
♦ Career Highlights: 4x season finale headliner; 1x anniversary event headliner; 1x mid-season main eventer; 6x Battle Royal champion [first-ever, most all-time]; 1x Rimshot Contest champion
♦ Awards & Accolades: 2010 "Perfect Attendance"; 2008 "Captain of the Year" finalist; 2007 "Concept of the Year" (CREAMation Rules); 2006 "High Jump"
♦ Major Contributions: innovator of PickYourPoison, CREAMation Rules, White Flag, and EnduraDodgeball matches; innovator of Rimshot Contest, Hit The Human Contest, and Championship Chase secondary attractions; innovator of Dodgeball Draft and Secret Selection; co-innovator of Wall vs. All (with R. Letsche); participated in CREAMations 1, 6, 9; created various promotional posters; put together several musical soundtracks; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts; purchased many dodgeballs

East Coast Dodgeball could not be more appreciative of the endless effort put forth by these legends. Their remarkable committment has undoubtedly provided a plethora of unforgettable moments for the entire ECD community.

The exclusive induction ceremony can be viewed below as filmed by newcomer Rob Knott and hosted by fellow Elitist Christopher Adams.



Attendance: 24, comprised of 16 men and 8 women. This was the largest turnout in the past four months.
New Dodgeballers: 3 - Grace Buckley, Devin Rich, Rob Knott.

Game Rules: Classic two-team.
Featured Match: Bobby Vetrano defeated Kenny Jacobs, 5 - 3. Eight games is the highest total number for any Family Affair event.
Game-By-Game Results: Vetrano 1, 3, 5-7; Jacobs 2, 4, 8
Captains Records: Vetrano 1-2-1; Jacobs 0-1-0
→ Vetrano won his very first singles match, having previously been vanquished by Rob Pellecchia and Ryan Letsche in the spring of 2008. This was his second time in a season finale-type outing, having competed as one of six captains at DODGEBALL 150 in the summer of 2008.
→ Jacobs became the astounding 80th recorded captain in ECD history. He joins Jason Teitelbaum and Jon Yochum as the only players whose debut match was at a Family Affair extravaganza.
Entrance Anthems: In an ECD first, entrance themes were used for each of the leading captains. Jacobs selected "Not Afraid" by Eminem while Vetrano went with Metallica's "For Whom The Bell Tolls".

ECDElite Inductees: Congratulations to Lauren Stopa and John Tronolone who became the 12th and 13th inductees into the prestigious Hall of Fame. The union of ECDElitist who preceded them are Kevin Megill, Justin Pierce, Valerie Winston, Ryan Letsche, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Chris Adams, Lauren Winston, Michael Edwards, Kevin Adams, Diana DiBuccio, and Michael "Sputz" Krott.

Raffle Winner: Congratulations to Justin Wolf who walked away with $10 worth of scratch-offs and a $10 Wawa gift card. Special thanks to both Katie Grand and Rob Knott who purchased the prize.

Musical Playlist: John Tronolone and Kevin Fitzpatrick
Theme Song: Red Hot Chili Peppers "By The Way"



__________________________________________________________________

The History of Family Affair

  • Family Affair I | May 31, 2008
    NOTES: Chronologically known as DODGEBALL CXL (140), the inaugural event produced an amazing 39 competitors and over 20 close friends and relatives watching from the sidelines.
    MAIN EVENT: Justin Wolf fought Juan Londono to a 2-2 tie. The infamous Wolf-Londono rivalry was jumpstarted at FA I - the first of three barbaric contest between them that year.

  • Family Affair II | May 23, 2009
    NOTES: Officially hyped as Family Reunion, it is the sole event within the Tronolone Era where no numerical statistics other than the match result were recorded.
    MAIN EVENT: Jason Teitelbaum defeated Jon Yochum, 4 - 1. To date, this is the only time either Teitelbaum or Yochum have been leading general.

  • Family Affair III | July 24, 2010
    NOTES: This monumental event ushered in the rebirth of East Coast Dodgeball on a monthly basis.
    MAIN EVENT: Sascha Basista defeated Joey Smalls, 4 - 2. This was the deciding bout in their best of three series.
